thread.title: 'Drunk' passenger hauled off flight by police armed with Tasers
thread.title_full: 'Drunk' passenger hauled off flight by police armed with Tasers

author: Chris Slater
title: 'Drunk' passenger hauled off flight by police armed with Tasers
text:
News 'Drunk' passenger hauled off flight by police armed with Tasers The drama happened on a Ryanair flight from Eindhoven in Holland which was unable to land due to Storm Doris and was diverted to Liverpool’s John Lennon Airport Share Police armed with Tasers stormed the plane after a drunk passenger stumbled along the aisle during a rocky landing (Photo: Liverpool Echo)   
A drunk passenger was hauled off a Manchester-bound flight by police with Tasers after he stood and walked along the aisle during its difficult landing. 
The Ryanair flight from Eindhoven in Holland was unable to land due to Storm Doris and was diverted to Liverpool’s John Lennon Airport. 
However as the pilots battled to touch down safely in high winds, the “heavily drunk” passenger is said to have got up and walked along the aisle. 
Police were called and after landing officers boarded the aircraft shouting “Taser-armed police coming through,” as they rushed through the cabin. 
Other passengers were asked to remain on board “while paramedics arrive,” although it is not clear why. Read More Burglar fell 130ft to his death as he climbed from flat balcony after stealing Xbox 
The flight had been due to land in Manchester at 12.05pm but arrived in Liverpool at 1pm because of the storm, before the drunken man was led away by police. 
It has been confirmed he was led away at the request of the captain but was not arrested. 
Speaking from the plane, a passenger who did not wish to be named, said: “The man was heavily drunk, the plane was moving all over the shop as we were coming in to land and he was just walking up and down the aisles, smiling and wishing everyone a good trip. 
“The crew had warned him about five times to sit down and other passengers were telling him to sit down and shut up. 
“He seemed to keep getting up to try and get more alcohol and seemed oblivious to the fact we were trying to land and the plane was jumping all over the place. 
“The steward on the announcer thanked us for our patience and said one passenger would be getting an unexpected surprise when we landed. 
“It was quite dramatic when the police came on, they shouted, ‘Taser-armed police coming through.’” The flight had been diverted away from Manchester Airport (Photo: Hufton+Crow) Read More Pilot gives cheeky wave after heart-stopping Storm Doris landing at Manchester Airport 
He added: “Then we were asked to stay seated and wait for paramedics to come on board but I have no idea why, I think someone may have needed some air.” 
A spokesman for John Lennon Airport confirmed that the flight had been diverted to Merseyside from Manchester because of the effects of Storm Doris. 
Buses have been laid on to ferry the stranded passengers back to Manchester. 
A Merseyside Police spokesman said: “The man was removed from the flight at the request of the captain as he was being disruptive, but he was not arrested and went on his way.” Like us on Facebook
